titleStmt.title: A comparison of the life of man, concerning how fickle his estate doth stand, flourishing like a tree, or vine, or dainty flower, or like a ship, or raine, that's turn'd each houre. To the tune of Sir Andrew Barton.
titleStmt.author: Crimsal, Richard.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "As I lay musing all alone ..."
In two parts; woodcut illustrations at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
